definitions.definition: the act of showing something, for example works of art, to the public

examples.text: She refused to allow the exhibition of her husband's work.
The portrait is going on public exhibition for the first time.
Hundreds of companies had exhibition stands.
The new wing will provide 20 000 more square feet of exhibition space.

definitions.definition: the act of showing a skill, a feeling, or a kind of behaviour

examples.text: We were treated to an exhibition of the footballer's speed and skill.
an appalling exhibition of bad manners

definitions.definition: an amount of money that is given as a prize to a student
to behave in a bad or stupid way in public

examples.text: I'm afraid I lost my temper and made an exhibition of myself.

wordOrigin: late Middle English (in the sense ‘maintenance, support’; hence sense (4), mid 17th cent.): via Old French from late Latin exhibitio(n-), from Latin exhibere ‘hold out’, from ex- ‘out’ + habere ‘hold’.
